Variables and units

Variables and units

Magnitude

Variable

Units

Comments

Hydraulic

Height

\(H or z\)

\(m\)

Flow

\(Q\)

\(m^3/s\)

⚠ Interfering with Reactive power. Change to F ?

Control Flow

\(Q_{control}\)

\(m^3/s\)

Height depending flow

Volume

\(W\)

\(m^3\)

Rotational speed

\(n\)

\(rpm\)

Linear pressure loss coefficient

\(K\)

\(s/m^2\)

Pump efficiency

\(\eta_{i}\)

\(pu\)

Pump On

\(PumpOn\)

Status of the pump binary variable

Auxiliar

\(aux\)

Binary auxiliar variable

Electrical

Active power

\(P\)

\(W\)

Defined positive if consumed by the device

Reactive power

\(Q\)

\(VAR\)

TBD: Q(inductive) same sign as in P?

Current

\(I\)

\(A\)

Voltage

\(V\)

\(V\)

State of Health

\(SOC\)

\(pu\)

Battery efficiency

\(\eta_{ch/dch}\)

\(pu\)

\(\eta_{dch} = 2-\eta_{ch}\)

Global

Time

\(t\)

\(s\)

Energy

\(E\)

\(Wh\)

Forecast

\(f(t)\)

\(pu\)

In p.u. of peak power, referenced at \(1000 W/m^2\)
